cont.entity_a: No background noise. No hiss or other noises; just clear sound as expected. Offers great sound quality. Good stereo decoding capabilities with support for Dolby and DTS. The headphones work well for short-range listening. Some sound interruptions occur when the signal is blocked.
cont.entity_b: Better sound quality with simulated surround than older Sennheiser models. No sound leakage, ideal for late-night listening. Good sound quality and noise minimization. Headphones are not as clear as expected but do the job.

cont.entity_a: Comfortable for shorter periods but can cause ear soreness over time. The design is a bit bulky but comfortable overall. The fit and finish are not extremely comfortable, but better than okay.
cont.entity_b: Comfortable fit with better wireless and battery life. Headphones are lightweight and comfortable.

cont.entity_a: Batteries that come with the product don't hold a charge after extended use, but new rechargeable batteries solve the issue. Replacement batteries are expensive and often out of stock. The headset lacks a stand and requires removing batteries for recharging.
cont.entity_b: The proprietary battery is not easily replaceable.

Build.comm: Headphones have weak joints prone to breaking.

cont.entity_b: The construction is poor with weak plastic joints.

cont.entity_a: Requires line of sight for optimal performance; any obstruction can interrupt sound. Offers multiple audio input options, including laser, left-right audio input, and digital coax. Volume is adjustable and strong without any static. Headphones are ideal for watching TV or listening to music without disturbing others.
cont.entity_b: Static noise occurs when moving the head. Volume control is hard to find when needed. Reception is good but cuts out when phone rings. The range is limited, not suitable for large areas.
